intro: Vinticena schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers, which are typically followed by orange or red berries. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Vinticena schweinfurthii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas.
